text.title: In the Garden
content: It is sunny. Thomas is working in his garden. He has set up a spot for tomatoes. Right now, he is watering his sunflowers. They are very tall, taller than him. Each sunflower has bright yellow petals. All the sunflowers are growing straight toward the sky, except one. One of the sunflowers leans toward the ground. It looks like it is talking to Lia, Thomas's dog.
Lia barks at the sunflower, but the sunflower does not respond. Lia barks again and sits down. Thomas puts down his watering can and opens the garden gate.
"You see, Lia," he says, "the flowers will not talk to you. I can do that. It’s time to have fun."

questions.question: Thomas waters his tomatoes in the garden.
One of the sunflowers seems to talk to Lia.
Lia barks at Thomas because she wants to play.
Thomas explains to Lia that flowers cannot talk.
What is likely to happen next?
choices: Lia will bark at the tomatoes.

questions.question: What can you do to learn more about sunflowers?
choices: Read an invented story about a garden.

questions.question: Why does Lia bark at the sunflower?
choices: She wants to go into the garden.
She thinks the sunflower is talking to her.
The sunflower leans toward the ground.
questions.correctAnswer: She thinks the sunflower is talking to her.

questions.question: In the text, it says that the sunflowers grow straight toward the sky. What does that mean?
choices: The flowers are taller than Thomas.

vocabularyTrueFalse.question: Lia is a dog of Thomas.
Thomas's garden is at his house.
Sunflowers always grow straight to the sky.

vocabularyQCM.question: What does 'pétale' mean?
choices: The colored part of the flower
vocabularyQCM.correctAnswer: The colored part of the flower.
